conclusion: Consider refraction of light from glass sphere to air and total internal reflection concept.
Critical angle is angle of incidence in glass for which angle of refraction in air is 90 degrees.
Calculate critical angle using Snell's Law: sin(theta_c) = 1/n, theta_c = arcsin(1/n).
Position light source so none of the light rays hit sphere surface at angle greater than critical angle.
Maximum angle of incidence occurs when light ray is tangent to sphere from point source.
Distance from point source to point of incidence on sphere is R, distance from center to point source is d.
Using trigonometry, angle of incidence theta is given by: sin(theta) = d/R.
Condition for no total internal reflection: d/R <= sin(theta_c), d/R <= 1/n, d <= R/n.
Final answer: point light source should be positioned such that its distance from center is <= R/n.
